findings.claim_summary: Daily wage formula inconsistency between leave policy and payroll settings
findings.validation_approach: Navigate to both Payroll Settings Daily Wage Calculator and Leave Policy configuration to compare formula displays and verify override behavior
findings.expected_outcome: Formula field in leave policy should be greyed out/disabled when overridden by payroll settings, with both locations showing salary component calculation (basic + allowances / days)
observable_elements: Payroll Settings daily wage formula display

findings.claim_summary: Unpaid leave deduction not recalculated when salary configuration changes
findings.validation_approach: Navigate to Salary Configuration to identify configuration dates/versions, then check Leave Requests to verify deduction amounts reflect current vs previous salary configuration
findings.expected_outcome: Unpaid leave deduction amounts should be calculated using current salary configuration (salary / 30.41 Ã— days), not previous configuration

findings.claim_summary: EOS gratuity calculator does not account for leap years (366 days)
findings.validation_approach: Navigate to End of Service Gratuity report/calculator, inspect service period calculation for employees with service spanning leap year 2024, verify if system counts 365 or 366 days
findings.expected_outcome: Service days calculation should recognize leap years (366 days for 2024) and reflect correct total working days in gratuity calculation (21 days per year for 1-5 years service)

prerequisites: Access to End of Service Gratuity calculator

summary: All 3 validation claims are logically valid and executable. VAL-001 validates daily wage formula override behavior (medium complexity). VAL-002 validates unpaid leave deduction recalculation logic with salary configuration changes (high complexity, requires multiple data states). VAL-003 validates EOS gratuity leap year day counting (high complexity, requires specific date ranges). All claims have well-defined navigation paths, observable indicators, and expected outcomes suitable for interface validation.
